varieties.name: CLUB RAYS, Concave Ends, UNITED STATES
characteristics: Concave (curved inward) ends on club rays
Contains FUCIO misspelling variety in late die state

coins.obverse_description: Sundial with "FUGIO" above, club-shaped rays with concave ends, date "1787"
coins.reverse_description: 13 linked rings with "WE ARE ONE" in center, "UNITED STATES" around rim
distinguishing_features: Concave (curved inward) ends on club rays
Contains FUCIO misspelling variety in late die state
identification_keywords: club rays, concave ends, united states
common_names: Fugio Cent - CLUB RAYS, Concave Ends, UNITED STATES
coins.source_citation: PCGS Registry, Newman Die Marriage Catalog, APMEX Historical Guide
coins.notes: Federal Contract Coinage - CLUB RAYS, Concave Ends, UNITED STATES. Newman marriages: 19-S, 20-T. First official U.S. cent authorized by Congress.

coins.obverse_description: Liberty head with flowing hair facing right, 'LIBERTY' above, date '1793' below
coins.reverse_description: 15-link chain enclosing 'ONE CENT' and fraction '1/100', 'UNITED STATES OF AMERI.' around rim
distinguishing_features: First official U.S. cent for circulation

coins.obverse_description: Liberty head with flowing hair facing right, 'LIBERTY' above, date '1793' below

coins.obverse_description: Draped bust of Liberty facing right, 'LIBERTY' above, date below

coins.obverse_description: Liberty head with coronet inscribed 'LIBERTY', date below, 13 stars around rim

coins.obverse_description: Eagle in flight facing left, 'UNITED STATES OF AMERICA' above, date below
coins.reverse_description: Agricultural wreath of wheat, corn, cotton, tobacco enclosing 'ONE CENT'
distinguishing_features: Striking problems with eagle's head and tail
coins.source_citation: U.S. Mint official records, PCGS CoinFacts
coins.notes: First small cent design, 1856 were patterns only
